body:
WARNING: At least one of the links in the message below goes to an IP address (e.g.
10.1.1.1), which could be malicious. To learn how to protect yourself, please go here:
http://www.lbl.gov/cyber/services/suspicious-links.html




Ok, I tried to get some more info on the error. wget is helpful here in 
verbose mode:


wget -v http://128.3.180.13:3389/
--2011-08-24 19:27:33--  http://128.3.180.13:3389/
Verbindungsaufbau zu 128.3.180.13:3389... verbunden.
HTTP-Anforderung gesendet, warte auf Antwort... 403 max listeners reached
2011-08-24 19:27:33 FEHLER 403: max listeners reached.


So there is whatever limit of listeners, and that blocks us. Nothing to 
do on the client-side as far as I can see.


Again, if anyone records and the organisators are fine with a working 
low-tech-solution, switch on your phones :-)


Cheers, Lars.
___
<sup>Automatically generated content from [radiance mailing-list](https://radiance-online.org/pipermail/radiance-general/2011-August/008116.html).</sup>
